column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples with nominal compositions of SmFeAsO1-xFx  (x = 0–0.35) were synthesized by a single-step solid-state reaction method using high-purity (>99.99%) SmAs, Fe2O3, FeF2, and Fe as starting materials.
#Text=The raw materials were mixed according to the stoichiometric ratios, pressed into pellets, and then sealed in evacuated quartz ampoules.
#Text=Ta foils were used to hold the pellets and avoid contact with the quartz.
#Text=Optimally doped samples (x = 0.2) were synthesized in a very wide temperature range 800–1100 °C in steps of 50 °C (not shown here) in order to find the best synthesis temperature (900 °C).
#Text=Finally, the quartz ampoules, with all samples of SmFeAsO1-xFx  inside, were heated to 900 °C for 45 h followed by cooling to room temperature at a rate of 30 °C/h.
#Text=All chemical manipulations were performed in an argon-filled glove box.
#Text=Several samples belonging to different batches were prepared by this procedure, and they showed high reproducibility with regard to the superconducting properties.
#Text=The resulting samples were characterized by powder XRD using Cu-Kα radiation.
#Text=The lattice parameters were obtained by a least squares fit of the observed d values.
